title: American_Top_40_1981_November_7th
description:
"I'm Casey Kasem and we're on our way to the number one song in the USA, countin' 'em down."


American Top 40 with Casey Kasem aired on radio from July 4, 1970 until August 6, 1988. This is a recording of a rebroadcast from internet radio.

In this broadcast there is a chart first. Two members of the same group have top 40 hits at the same time while the group is still active. It happens in the second hour.

The Go-Go's have their first chart single with "Our Lips Are Sealed" (at number 35), as does Al Jarreau with "We're In This Love Together" (at number 15).

A listener wants to know, "Who were the first brother and sister duo to hit number one?" This brother and sister didn't advertise the fact that they were related, and went by different last names. As you know, Casey tells us all about it.

Casey explains how the band Quarterflash got its name, and what the phrase "Young Turks" means.

In the history of the chart (so far) there have been 8 songs that identify a woman with a particular place (such as "Tallahassee Lassie" or "The Little Old Lady From Pasadena"). The 9th is in this countdown.

The Four Tops are on the chart for the first time since 1973 with their song "When She Was My Girl" (at number 11).

A listener wants to know if any top 40 song titles name any professional athletes. Casey says there have been two songs about boxers.
